snippet: The Justice Department said that one of the men was arrested at an airport, where he planned to begin a journey to Syria to fight with ISIS, and that the other assisted him.
abstract: Justice Dept charges Joseph Hassan Farrokh and Mahmoud Amin Mohamed of Virginia with terrorism-related offenses in connection with attempt to travel to Syria to fight for Islamic State; both men are in FBI custody and could face up to 20 years in prison.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department said that one of the men was arrested at an airport, where he planned to begin a journey to Syria to fight with ISIS, and that the other assisted him.

headline.main: Virginia Man Is Accused of Trying to Join ISIS
headline.print_headline: Virginia Man Is Accused of Trying to Join ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
